alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Laurel, east central Pulaski, southern Jackson, southeastern Rockcastle and northwestern Clay Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 230 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Luner, or 10 miles northwest of London, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... London, Hazel Patch, Camp Wildcat, Hare, Carmichael, Sinks and Pittsburg around 235 PM EDT. Mershons, Lamero, Victory, Templer, Horse Lick, East Bernstadt, Gauley, Jep Hill, Donaro and Withers around 240 PM EDT. Eberle, Parrot, Peoples, Carico, Middlefork, Cruise, Ardery, Greenmount, Atlanta and Dango around 245 PM EDT. Deese, Cornelius, Dabolt, Bond, Moores Creek, Green Hill, Shop Branch and Royrader around 250 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Olin, Mildred, Atkinstown, Annville, Settle Store, Tyner, Welchburg, Egypt, High Knob, Hurley, McKee, Privett, Herd, Gray Hawk, Zekes Point, Bradshaw and Macedonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
